intro: Senecio pectinatus var. major, commonly known as the Woolly Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly gray-green foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a distinctive addition to arid landscapes.
